edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the grid that the game takes place on and all of the objects interact with each other in, one of the fundamental parts of the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      private int BOARDSIZE
      This field represents the size of the board and is a constant that will be used when creating the board.
      private Locatable[][] boardState
      This field represents the state of the board and will contain different objects that implement Locatable.

    • Field Detail

      • BOARDSIZE

        private final int BOARDSIZE
        This field represents the size of the board and is a constant that will be used when creating the board. Note: This value is hardcoded in other places, so changing it here will not have the desired effect.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • boardState

        private Locatable[][] boardState
        This field represents the state of the board and will contain different objects that implement Locatable. The contents of this array usually won't be visible to the player, and is mostly used for the system to locate objects.

      • getObject

        public Locatable getObject(int row,
                           int col)
        This method returns the object located at certain coordinates.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the target square
        col - The column of the target square
        Returns:
        found object.

      • getObject

        public Locatable getObject(Location l)
        This method essentially does the same thing as getObject(int, int) but gets it's coordinates from a location object.
        Parameters:
        l - location with the coordinates
        Returns:
        found object.

      • getObject

        public Locatable getObject(Location l,
                           Direction d)
        This method does the same thing as getObject(Location) but adds a directional modifier.
        Parameters:
        l - location to search
        d - direction to go
        Returns:
        object found.

        finds and returns the player on the grid.
        Returns:

      • setPos

        public boolean setPos(int row,
                      int col,
                      Locatable item)
        This method sets the object to a set of coordinates, and updates that object's Location. Movement fails if the destination does not equal null or does not exist.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the target square
        col - The column of the target square
        Returns:
        whether the object was moved successfully

        Returns:
        truth or not.

      • removePos

        public void removePos(int Row,
                      int Col)
        This method removes the object located at a set of coordinates.
        Parameters:
        Row - First array index to search.
        Col - Second array to search.

      • placeStartingObjects

        public void placeStartingObjects(Player player,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Ninja> ninjaList,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<WorldItem> itemList)
        This method places the player, rooms, ninjas, powerups, and the briefcase onto the grid, and will be used when starting a brand new game.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be inserted into the grid.
        ninjaList - Ninjas to be inserted into the grid.
        itemList - Items to be inserted into the grid.

      • addNinja

        private void addNinja(Ninja n,
                      java.util.Random randomGenerator,
                      Player player)
        Selects a random valid position on the grid and places a specified Ninja there.
        Parameters:
        n - the Ninja to place
        randomGenerator - the Random to use to get random numbers
        player - the player to avoid putting objects near

      • addItem

        private void addItem(WorldItem item,
                     java.util.Random randomGenerator,
                     Player player)
        Selects a random valid position on the grid and places a specified WorldItem there, also placing it in unoccupied rooms.
        Parameters:
        item - the WorldItem to place
        randomGenerator - the Random to use to get random numbers
        player - the player to avoid putting objects near

      • checkForNearLocatable

        public boolean checkForNearLocatable(Locatable loc,
                                     int row,
                                     int col,
                                     int d)
        This method checks if the given coordinates are a certain (Manhattan) distance away from a specified Locatable object or not. For example, a distance of 2 will return true if the square is within one square of the selected object.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the square to look at
        col - The column of the square to look at
        d - How big the search square should be
        Returns:
        whether coordinates are near enough to the Locatable object or not.

      • checkForNearLocatable

        public boolean checkForNearLocatable(Locatable loc,
                                     int row,
                                     int col)
        This method checks if the given coordinates are one square away from a specified Locatable object or not (including diagonally).
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the square to look at
        col - The column of the square to look at
        Returns:
        whether coordinates are next to the Locatable object or not.

      • checkForAdjacent

        public boolean checkForAdjacent(Locatable loc,
                                int row,
                                int col)
        This method checks if a given coordinates are adjacent to the specified Locatable
        Parameters:
        loc - specified locatable
        row - row to check
        col - col to check
        Returns:
        truth value
